loginManagement module¶

loginManagement.delete()¶

delete will delete the user of the database with the loggin information given in information. If the access_token give in body args doesn’t have the right access to delete user, our API will return an error.

@login = login of the user(email).

@access_token = Token of the user doing the request

example of request :

http://127.0.0.1:5000/delete

login=simon1.provost@epitech.eu

access_token=$2b$12$mmML0e8FfPoKsLKyrTidje7lf9erfSu2OkV4NOUV.NuK7IF4z6CoW

Returns

{“error”: “404”, “message”: “Either the access_token doesn’t have the right access or your user didn’t exist in our database.”} Success:{“success”: “200”, “message”: “user deleted.”}. br>

loginManagement.isPasswordValid(self, password)¶

isPasswordValid will check if the password encrypted and the non encrypted password given in arguments match or not.

Parameters

  • self – password encrypted.(database)

  • password – password of the user.

Returns

true if it’s a match, false otherwise.

loginManagement.login()¶

login will login the user and give an access token from our API if the user log correspond in the database. if the loggin information was right, we will add the access token in his database cell as well.

@login = login of the user(email).

@password = password of the user.

example of request :

http://127.0.0.1:5000/login

login=simon1.provost@epitech.eu

password=1p54er7H#

Returns

Error: {“error”: “404”, “message”: “Wrong password or username”} Success: {“success”: “200”, “access_token”: access_token}

loginManagement.makePasswordHash(password)¶

makePasswordhash will encrypt a password given in argument and return the password encrypted.

Parameters

password – the password of the user.

Returns

encrypted password.

loginManagement.modifyPermission()¶

modifyPermission will change the permission admin of a specific user given in body args. Obviously you need to give an access token which have the right access to modify the permission of any user.

@login = login of the user(email).

@access_token = Token of the user doing the request.

@admin = new permission that you need to change.

example of request :

http://127.0.0.1:5000/register

login=simon1.provost@epitech.eu

access_token=$2b$12$mmML0e8FfPoKsLKyrTidje7lf9erfSu2OkV4NOUV.NuK7IF4z6CoW

admin=1

Returns

json string will be return. Error: {“error”: “404”, “message”: “Either the access_token doesn’t have the right access or your user didn’t exist in our database.”} Success: {“success”: “200”, “message”: “Account updated”}

loginManagement.register()¶

register will add the user information to our database.

@login = login of the user(email).

@password = password of the user.

@admin = the admin permission of the user in our plateform. (1 || 0)

example of request :

http://127.0.0.1:5000/register

login=simon1.provost@epitech.eu

password=1p54er7H#

admin=1

Returns

Error : {“error”: “404”, “message”: “An account already exists with this email address”} Success : {“success”: “200”, “message”: “user registered.”} .
